attributes.action: Put more emphasis on Mass Antibody Testing!?
attributes.additional_details:
We cannot hide away forever and by doing so you are just prolonging the duration for this virus to infect others, hoping some how that it will burn itself out. By the time that happens this country will be in tatters, both morally and economically!

The UK has always come together in times of hardship, we have never shied away from a fight. In both WW1 and WW2 the nation stood tall, standing shoulder-to shoulder and we prevailed!

Lets make a stand now.

TEST FOR VICTORY
attributes.background:
Surely a better way to approach the handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in the UK: 

Lets test everyone to see who has actually been exposed to COVID-19 and is immune to it. Let those people who are immune go back to work, lets build that national picture of herd immunity.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced the start of a major new national antibody testing programme, with plans to provide antibody tests to NHS and care staff in England from the end of May: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-antibody-tests/coronavirus-covid-19-antibody-tests

If you want the Government to prioritise other groups for antibody testing, you could start a new petition requesting this.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
